title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 10): Building Power With - Community Makerspaces for Resilience and Repair
summary: Transform makerspaces from tech-elite domains into grassroots hubs for autonomy and communal care. Create shared workshops that foster local resilience, solidarity, and post-capitalist infrastructure.

Knowledge.summary: Democratize technical skills and tools through collective learning and making.

level0: Start with listening to community needs and capacities
Find or share accessible space for collaborative making
level1: Create horizontal organizing structure with consensus decision-making
Collect tools through community reclamation rather than purchasing
level2: Build culture of skill-sharing rather than expertism
Make repair and reuse central to space mission
level3: Build relational infrastructure that sustains long-term collaboration
Support others in starting their own community makerspaces

Community.summary: Create shared infrastructure for collective problem-solving and creative collaboration.

level0: Use working groups based on capacity and interest, not credentials
Host regular workshops taught by community volunteers
level1: Make space welcoming to all identities and skill levels
Create multilingual signage and visual instruction materials
level2: Host recurring repair cafés and fix-it events
Document successful projects in community repair wiki
level3: Become community hub for mutual aid infrastructure building
Create network of connected makerspaces across region

Narrative.summary: Reclaim making and repair as community practices rather than individual consumption.

level0: Challenge tech-elite culture in traditional maker spaces
Practice seeing making as collective rather than individual achievement
level1: Share stories about community-controlled technology and tools
Model alternatives to startup culture and tech evangelism
level2: Help others understand makerspaces as civic infrastructure
Promote repair culture over consumption and disposal
level3: Transform understanding of technology toward community ownership
Build culture where collective making serves liberation not profit
